title: Why is it instinct to form groups and fight other groups? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s mainly because diversity also means diverse identities… Peoples groups because of their identity and the fact that alone, one is cursed to grow from a void. As many prefers to be proven to exist by others, instead of proving themselves that they exist… In many ways, it is easier to define one identity within a group than being alone. As a group works as a mirror to oneself… Fighting occurs mainly when cooperation fails. As such cooperation requires some basic identity recognition (so that they can relate to each other). But when groups fail to relate to each other, conflict ensues. The scale of such conflict will depend on many vectors, most of them social (therefore related to the identity of the group). Another thing is that when groups collide, ideas collide… As violence is also a form of changes. Quick changes. This also contributes to the growth of a group identity… Man sees such growth through increase in wealth and influences. Then soon, you see another human traits appear, greed for power… But conquest, evolutionary speaking, has nothing to do with human Ego, and everything to do with growth of identity, being for a group, a nation or a society…

It isn’t. This is the now debunked theory of ethologists like Conrad Lorenz back in the 1960s. Intergroup Aggression in Chimpanzees and Humans [and Comments and Replies] Newer studies find that groups do not have “instincts”.
